title.narrative: 1.10 Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT

description.narrative: Government and partners have capacity to scale up improved service delivery at community and facility level sanitation and hygiene especially for the most deprived communities, which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Sanitation, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Wash â€“ General, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Programme Component Results (PCR) 1: Mother and child survival, growth and development and Programme Component Results (PCR) 2: Protective and learning environment

sector.narrative: Child marriage - surveys (e.g. KAP, VACS), data analysis/research/evaluation evidence generation, synthesis, and use

WASH - Enabling environment (policies/strategies, coordination, regulation, financing, planning-monitoring-review, sector capacity development and professionalization)
WASH - risk informed programming including climate resilience disaster and conflict

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Government and partners have capacity to scale up improved service delivery at community and facility level sanitation and hygieneespecially for the most deprived communities

description.narrative: The Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) programme has supported government and stakeholders to develop knowledge products that influenced decision-making at the national and state levels, and the output has achieved its target. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:13/01/2018

title.narrative: Key national and state policies, strategies, and plans are evidence-based and reflect an analysis of current issues
